summary: Build a self-improvement app ("My Algorithm Personality") that lets users upload/paste their online activity data (screenshots/text) to automatically detect multiple habit/behavior patterns and generate a personalized 30-day program with daily check-ins and auto-generated atomic habit tasks, using a curated library inspired by habit psychology/feedback loops and Bruce Lipton; prioritize a visually appealing, easy-to-use UI and simplify features to what’s workable.
architectural_notes: Avoid direct social media API integrations; rely on user-provided screenshots/text uploads as the core data source.
MVP should prioritize simplification to ensure a workable end-to-end flow: ingest data → detect patterns → generate plan/tasks → daily check-ins → progress view.
Patterns Dashboard will include additional analytics sections (trends/segments) and feed those insights back into the 30-day program generation/update logic (adaptive planning loop).
known_issues: Initial attempt to "build it" failed due to platform limitations; requires simplified MVP scope.

existing_features.title: Create an MVP app flow that lets a signed-in user (Internet Identity) provide their online-activity data via (a) pasted text and (b) optional screenshot/image uploads, and store each entry with timestamp, source label (e.g., “Shopping”, “Social feed”, “Messages”, “Browsing”), and optional user notes.

Implement on-device/app-side (non-LLM) pattern detection from the user’s pasted text using transparent heuristics, producing multiple pattern types at once (at minimum: shopping/spending triggers, emotional tone signals, time-of-day habit hints, screen-time/scrolling cues, and cue-craving-reward feedback-loop language). Save detected patterns with confidence scores and the text snippets that triggered them.

Create a curated in-app “Atomic Habit Library” (seed catalog) organized by goals/categories focused on presence and reversing negative loops (e.g., Digital Balance, Spending Awareness, Mindful Pausing, Sleep/Wind-down, Relationships/Connection, Focus/Deep Work, Emotional Regulation). Each habit includes: a tiny action, when-to-do cue, duration, difficulty, and a brief rationale grounded in habit/feedback-loop framing (Bruce Lipton-inspired tone allowed, but keep it practical and non-medical).

Generate a personalized 30-day program for each user based on their detected patterns and the habit library. The program must assign one “Daily Micro-Task” per day, plus an optional “Reflection Prompt”, and explain why it was chosen (linked to detected patterns).

Implement a daily check-in flow for the active 30-day program: mark task as done/not done, capture a 1–5 mood rating, optional short note, and whether the user reduced/avoided the targeted behavior that day. Show compounding progress over time.

Create a “Patterns Dashboard” that summarizes the user’s top detected loops/triggers over the last N entries (e.g., last 7/30), highlights most frequent pattern types, and shows which program tasks are targeting which patterns.

Add a cohesive, visually appealing UI theme and information architecture optimized for ease of use: calm, presence-oriented styling (avoid blue/purple), clear onboarding, and minimal steps to (1) add data, (2) see patterns, (3) start program, (4) check in.
Generate and include minimal brand/static imagery for the MVP (logo + subtle background/hero illustration) and render them as static assets from the frontend.

Expand the Patterns Dashboard to include additional analytics sections (as new visual sections, not replacing existing ones) covering: (1) emotional trends over time, (2) shopping/spending triggers over time, and (3) morning vs night pattern distribution, using the existing 7/30 day window selector.

Implement dashboard-side insight calculations (non-LLM, transparent heuristics) that derive the new analytics from existing stored Patterns (and where needed, recent Activity Entries), and expose them to the Patterns Dashboard UI in a reusable way.

Make Patterns Dashboard insights automatically influence and update the user’s personalized 30‑day program by regenerating the program when new patterns materially change the insight signals, while preserving already-recorded daily check-ins.

Upgrade the app’s layout and visual design to feel more polished and high-impact (inspired by the feel/movement of Tony Robbins / Atomic Habits sites) while staying within the existing calm, warm-neutral palette (avoid blue/purple) and without changing core navigation or features.
Update the existing generated hero/background and/or logo imagery to better match the upgraded high-impact design direction, keeping the same filenames in /assets/generated used by the app.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create app "My Algorithm Personality" focused on reversing negative online habit loops and improving presence using user-provided online activity data
Data ingestion without direct social API integrations: allow users to upload screenshots and paste text/logs as primary input methods
Automatic multi-pattern detection from uploaded/pasted data (e.g., shopping triggers, emotional tone, time-of-day loops, screen-time/feedback-loop behaviors)
Personalized 30-day improvement program generated from detected patterns, with daily check-in flow and compounding progress tracking

Auto-generate daily atomic habits/tasks based on detected patterns, seeded by a small curated catalog informed by research (habits, addiction/feedback loops, presence-building) and Bruce Lipton-inspired framing
Visually appealing, easy-to-use UI/UX; simplify scope to a workable usable application within platform constraints
Backend persistence: store per-user entries, detected pattern results, habit library (seeded), active/previous programs, and daily check-ins in the single Motoko actor with stable storage as needed.
Enhance Patterns Dashboard with additional analytics/insights (e.g., emotional trends, spending triggers over time, morning vs night patterns) as new visual sections
Make Patterns Dashboard insights automatically influence/update the personalized 30-day program (adaptive program adjustments based on new analytics)
Upgrade UI/graphic design for a more polished, high-impact layout with modern “feel and movement” inspired by Tony Robbins / Atomic Habits style, within platform capabilities
